symptoms.name: Macules
symptoms.pattern: Initially small, hypopigmented or erythematous macules that gradually enlarge

symptoms.name: Papules
symptoms.pattern: May develop into papules, which can be hyperpigmented or depigmented

symptoms.name: Nodules
symptoms.pattern: In later stages, nodules may form

symptoms.name: Itch
symptoms.pattern: May be present, especially in early stages

physical_findings: Lesions may be distributed across the body

supportive: Serological tests (e.g., FTA-ABS, TPHA) may be helpful but are not always positive
